alert.note: Alert for East Polk; McMinn; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:34PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cherokee, Polk, southeastern McMinn and southwestern Monroe Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Athens to 9 miles northeast of Eton. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens, Benton, Ducktown, Etowah, Englewood, Tellico Plains, William L. Davenport Refuge, Big Frog Mountain, Parksville and Copperhill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern North Carolina...and east Tennessee.
